message.content: Yes, it’s becoming increasingly common—especially as AI assistants get better at holding helpful, non-judgmental conversations. People use them for everything from quick fact-checking and brainstorming to venting after a tough day. If the interaction feels useful or comforting and doesn’t crowd out real-world relationships, it’s generally considered normal and healthy. The key is to notice whether it’s enriching your life or replacing parts of it that might benefit from human connection.

conversation_history.text: Is it normal to talk to an AI every day?

Yes, it’s becoming increasingly common—especially as AI assistants get better at holding helpful, non-judgmental conversations. People use them for everything from quick fact-checking and brainstorming to venting after a tough day. If the interaction feels useful or comforting and doesn’t crowd out real-world relationships, it’s generally considered normal and healthy. The key is to notice whether it’s enriching your life or replacing parts of it that might benefit from human connection.
